text: Grewia asiatica is a flowering plant in the genus Grewia. It was first found in Varanasi, India and was taken by Buddhist scholars to other Asian countries and the rest of the world. Grewia celtidifolia was initially considered a mere variety of Phalsa, but is now recognized as a distinct species. It is grown for its sweet and sour acidic fruit, which is sold in the market during the summer months under the name falsa. ==References== Category:Malvaceae
title: Grewia asiatica
